definition: Success Rate calculated as the count of transactions with status 'DEEMED' or 'SUCCESS' divided by total transaction count, expressed as a decimal ratio.
Unified Payments Interface - a real-time payment system that facilitates inter-bank transactions through mobile platforms.
Person-to-Person transactions including VPA2ACCOUNT and VPA2VPA transaction types in the flow category.
Scan and Pay transactions including 3P QR and Paytm QR flow categories.
Online transactions including Intent, P2M Collect, and Mandate_Online flow categories.
On-us transactions including Onus_ExcMandates and Mandate_Onus flow categories processed within the same payment system.
Categorized grouping of UPI transaction flow categories into P2P, SnP, Online, Onus, or Others based on flow_category values.
Original transaction flow classification including P2P, 3P QR, Paytm QR, Intent, P2M Collect, Mandate_Online, Onus_ExcMandates, and Mandate_Onus.
Unique transaction identifier used for counting total transactions in success rate calculations.
Transaction processing status including DEEMED, SUCCESS, and other failure statuses used to determine transaction outcomes.
Day component extracted from the day_id (transaction_date_key) used for temporal analysis of success rates.
Person-to-Merchant transactions including VPA2MERCHANT transaction category
UPI transaction type where payment is made from Virtual Payment Address to bank account
UPI transaction type where payment is made between Virtual Payment Addresses
UPI transaction type where payment is made from Virtual Payment Address to merchant account
Transaction status indicating the UPI transaction was completed successfully without any errors.
A transaction status indicating the transaction is considered successful or completed under specific conditions.
A specific service request category related to UPI handle success rate analysis and monitoring.
The UPI handle identifier of the transaction initiator or payer in a UPI transaction.
Code identifying the purpose or reason for the UPI transaction
UPI handle or identifier of the transaction payee
